results.title: The Expressionist eye
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton, Australian National Gallery and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 19 of Series “The Australian eye IV”.
Recollections of Melbourne in the 1940s. Examines the rise of artists: Arthur Boyd, Josl Bergner, Joy Hester, Sidney Nolan, John Perceval, Albert Tucker Danila Vassilief, John Reed, Peter Herbst, Barrett Reid and Bernard Smith. This film provides an understanding of that rebellious period when the course of Australian art took a new direction under European Expressionism.

results.title: The Explorer
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Albert Tucker (1914-) is an intellectual artist with great independence of mind and mental courage. He has succeeded in fashioning a distinctive style and is now one of the leading artists in Australia. This film is based on a series of paintings by Tucker which deals with an unnamed explorer who perished in the outback desert. Imaginative paintings in an imaginative film.

results.title: The Expanding universe of sculpture
results.brief_description: Explores contemporary sculpture, using as examples works by artists, Reuben Nakina, Alex Leberman, David Burt, and Doris Chase who express their attitudes toward their work and the philosophy that motivates them. Includes a multi-media show which combines music, dance, light and sculpture and demonstrates the uses of a wide variety of materials.

results.title: The Existentialist cowboy's last stand
results.brief_description: Trapped up on a ridge, surrounded by a mean posse, a cowboy ponders his predicament - seeing it as a metaphor for life. Based on the book of the same name, this is French existentialism in a mid-Western American metaphor.

results.title: The Exceptional child
results.brief_description: A report on studies of children of unusual natural abilities or rate of development made in Great Britain, the United States and South Africa. Covers very rapid mental development, reading difficulties, stammering, accident proneness and delinquency, and evidence for pre-natal influence on these.

results.title: The Evolving world (NP)
results.creator_credit: Ashley Schwall-Kearney, Craig Saunders, ABC-TV (Australia), Monash University and Open Learning Agency of Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “The Global Economy”.
This episode of The Global Economy focuses on the changing nature of the world’s various economies by considering two examples: China as a developing economy (Passing on development) and the USA (Continual change, continual growth) with its dominance of the computer software industry. A panel of economists discuss the nature of change in the local market place and the effects this creates globally.

results.title: The Evolution of vascular plants: the ferns
results.brief_description: Describes the evolution of vascular systems in land plants. The highly specialised structures that occur in vascular plants are shown through investigation of the fern. The film explains the adaptive advantages of vascular systems in land plants, and shows how biologists reconstruct the story of the plant evolution by studying fossils and living plants.

results.title: The Everly Brothers: Album flash
results.creator_credit: Richard Deligter, Stephanie Bennett and Delilah Films
results.brief_description: During the recording of their new album, EB84 in 1984, The Everly Brothers were filmed in their Nashville studios, and in London. This video features in-depth interviews with Don and Phil and their record producer Dave Edmunds. Included are videos for their new songs “You make it seem so easy”, “The story of me”, “Following the sun”, and “On the wings of a nightingale”, penned by such music industry luminaries as Paul McCartney and Jeff Lynne. The result is a fascinating glimpse into the recording life of the Everlys.

results.title: The Ever-changing sky: John Constable 1776-1837
results.brief_description: An appraisal of John Constable, English landscape painter, who lived from 1776 to 1837. Depicts his birthplace and the scenes in Suffolk which inspired many of his paintings. He strove to capture the beauty of nature in his paintings with dramatic and emotional brushwork, and in his freedom and his sense of space and light, he can be seen as the precursor of the plain-air painting of the Impressionists.
